resources.string: Points of interest on this tour:

The left panel shows the tours of Oxford that you can choose from.
 Use the dropdown menu on the top bar to change how the tours are sorted. This can be done in 3 ways:
 - by filename (default)
 - alphabetically
 - by proximity to the start of the tour (needs a GPS signal)
 Touch a tour to see its details in the right panel.
 If you cannot see the complete list of locations on the tour, touch the list and scroll.
 When you decide which tour you want, click the blue Start Tour button!

You are now in a tour. Hold up your device as you go about the city of Oxford, and follow the directions to the next point of interest.
 POINTS OF INTEREST:
 The name and distance of the next location are on the bottom of the screen. Use the Previous or Next buttons to skip points.
 When you reach the next point of interest, the app will display information about it in a box, including recent tweets.
 A green marker may be visible on your screen when you reach the point.
 To return to the tour selection screen, press your device's Back button.
 MAP:
 Click Show Map to display a map of the tour (needs internet). You can then display and animate the route to the next point.
 Blue markers are visited points, green is the next point on the tour, purple are later points on the tour.
 To return to the camera view from the map, press your device's Back button.

This app, Augmented Oxford, was developed in 2014 by
 Aditya Sharad, Benjamin Dawes, Kristian Kostadinov, 
 Piotr Nosalik, Roland Batovski and Tristan Beardmore-Gray,
 as a Group Design Practical at the University of Oxford.
 Augmented reality behaviour implemented using the
 DroidAR framework (www.github.com/bitstars/droidar).
 Maps behaviour implemented using Google Maps API.
 Twitter feed implemented using Twitter4j.
 Other sources listed in the project report.
